document.docAuthor: Gravili, Cinzia, Vito, Doris De, Camillo, Cristina Gioia Di, Martell, Luis, Piraino, Stefano & Boero, Ferdinando
document.masterDocTitle: The non-Siphonophoran Hydrozoa (Cnidaria) of Salento, Italy with notes on their life-cycles: an illustrated guide

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The non-Siphonophoran Hydrozoa (Cnidaria) of Salento, Italy with notes on their life-cycles: an illustrated guide

subSubSection.paragraph:
See
Boero et al. ( 1997 a)
for a complete synonymy.
Material examined. HCUS-S 0 83 (Hydrozoa Collection, University of Salento—fauna of the Salento Peninsula).

Hydroid. Colonies stolonal; hydrocauli as erect pedicels scarcely, dichotomously or irregularly branched and ended in hydrothecae, perisarc undulated or twisted throughout; hydrothecae tubular, elongated, walls sometimes asymmetrical, narrowing gradually towards the base, with a hydrothecal diaphragm, margin everted, rim even. Gonothecae: female gonothecae spherical, male ones sac-shaped and elongated.

Substrate. Hydroids, algae,
Posidonia
, other organisms such as bryozoans, sponges, anthozoans, polychaete tubes, bivalve and gastropod shells, cirripedes, ascidians, and non-living substrata.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 76.
Scandia gigas
: A , hydrotheca; B , female gonotheca; C , male gonotheca (A, B, C same scale bar) (modified after Boero 1981a). Scale bar: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. In the Mediterranean area many authors used the name
Scandia pocillum
for
Lafoea gigas
Pieper, 1884
.
Boero ( 1981 a)
reintroduced the name
S. gigas
since
Cornelius ( 1975 )
showed that
L. pocillum
is conspecific with
L. dumosa .
Gonothecae and medusae not seen in the present study.

as
